title: Stats page displays accurate data
custom_preconds: Web app is in logged-out state

title: Stats calculations are correct
custom_preconds: Web app is in logged-out state

title: NL - Filter by historical
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps: WHEN selecting "1937" on the "Historical" filter
custom_expected: THEN  the "Leagues" filter should show "American Negro League" and "National Negro League"

title: NL - Filter by seasons
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN selecting "1920" on the "Historical" filter
AND selecting "Postseason" on the "Season"
custom_expected: THEN the "Leagues" filter should show "Negro National League (I)"

title: NL - Filter by league
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN selecting "1920" on the "Historical" filter
AND selecting "Regular Season" on the "Season" filter
AND selecting "Negro National League (I)"
custom_expected: THEN a list of players should show up sorted by OPS

title: NL - Filter by team
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN selecting "1920" on the "Historical" filter
AND selecting "Regular Season" on the "Season" filter
AND selecting "Negro National League (I)" on the "league" filter
AND selecting "Kansas City Monarchs" on the "Team" filter
custom_expected:
THEN a list of players should show up sorted by OPS
AND "Hurly McNair" should be number one on the list

title: NL - Filter by position
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN selecting "1920" on the "Historical" filter
AND selecting "Regular Season" on the "Season" filter
AND selecting "Negro National League" on the "league" filter
AND selecting "Kansas City Monarchs" on the "Team" filter
AND selecting "First Base" on the "Position" filter
custom_expected: THEN "George Carr" should be visible on the players list

title: NL -  1920 first record of the  "Negro National League"
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN selecting "1920" on the "Historical" filter
AND selecting "Negro National League (I)" in the "League" filter
custom_expected: THEN the list of players should be displayed with "Cristobal Torriente" in second place

title: NL - 1937 first record of the "Negro American League"
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN they select the "Hitting" tab
AND by selecting "1937" in the "Year" filter
custom_expected: THEN  the "Negro American League" should be visible by opening the "Leagues" filter

title: NL -1948 is the last year of the  "Negro American League" and "Negro National League"
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps: WHEN selecting "1948" on the "Historical" filter
custom_expected: THEN the "League" filter should have "Negro American League" and "Negro National League"

title: NL - 1949 should not have the "Negro American League" and "Negro National League" in the "Leagues" filter
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps: WHEN selecting "1949" on the "Historical" filter
custom_expected: THEN "Negro American League" and "Negro National League" should not be available in the "League" filter

title: NL - Filter data to get Satchel Paige in 1946
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN they select "Hitting" tab
AND they select "1946" on the year filter
AND they select "Negro American League" on the "League" filter
AND "Kansas City Monarchs" on the Teams filter
AND "Pitcher" in the "Position" filter
AND sort the data by the "G" column
custom_expected: THEN "Satchel Paige" should be displayed in the fifth place on the players list

title: NL - Jackie Robinson became the first African-American to integrate major league baseball in 1947
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN they select "Hitting" tab
AND they select "1947" in the year filter
AND "Brooklyn Dodgers" in the Teams filter
AND "First Base" in the Positions filter
custom_expected: THEN "Jackie Robinson" should be displayed in the first place in the players list

title: NL - Filter  data to get Cool Papa Bell in 1924
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN they select the "Hitting" tab
AND they selects "1924" on the year filter
AND "St. Louis Stars" on the Teams filter
AND "Center Field" on the "Positions" filter
custom_expected: THEN "Cool Papa Bell" should be displayed in the first place on the players list

title: NL - Filter by local team in the East Coast (N)  > Newark Stars
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN they select "Eastern Colored League" on the "Leagues" filter
AND "Newark Stars (1926)" on the "Teams" filter
AND click the "BB" header to change the sort in the table
custom_expected: THEN a list of players should be displayed with "Cleo Smith" on first place

title: NL - Filter by local team in the East Coast (S)  > Little Rock Grays
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN they select "Negro Southern League" on the "Leagues" filter
AND "Little Rock Grays (1932)" on the "Teams" filter
AND click the "BB" header to change the sort in the table
custom_expected: THEN a list of players should be displayed with "Pete McQueen" in first position

title: NL - Filter by local team in the Central  (N&S) > Columbus Buckeyes
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN they select "Negro National League(I)" on the "Leagues" filter
AND "Columbus Buckeyes (1921)" on the "Teams" filter
AND click the "BB" header to change the sort in the table
custom_expected: THEN a list of players should be displayed with "Robert Hudspeth" in first position

title: NL - Filter by local team in the Central (N&S) > Cuban Stars West
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN they select "Negro National League(I)" on the "Leagues" filter
AND "Cuban Stars West (1906 - 1930)" on the "Teams" filter
AND click the "BB" header to change the sort in the table
custom_expected: THEN a list of players should be displayed with "Felipe Sierra" in first position

title: NL - Handling of teams with same name > Toledo Crawfords (1939 - 1948)
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN they select "Negro American League" on the "Leagues" filter
AND they select "Toledo Crawfords (1939 - 1948)" on the "Teams" filter
AND click the "G" header to change the sort in the table
custom_expected: THEN a list of players should be displayed with "Curtis Henderson" in first position

title: NL - Handling of teams with same name > Toledo Crawfords (1931 - 1939)
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN they select "Negro National League (II)" on the "Leagues" filter
AND they select "Toledo Crawfords (1931 - 1939)" on the "Teams" filter
AND click the "G" header to change the sort in the table
custom_expected: THEN a list of players should be displayed with "Chester Williams" in first position

title: NL - Handling of teams with same name > Detroit Stars (1920 - 1937)
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN they select "Negro American League" on the "Leagues" filter
AND they select "Detroit Stars (1920 - 1937)" on the "Teams" filter
AND click the "G" header to change the sort in the table
custom_expected: THEN a list of players should be displayed with "Turkey Stearnes" in first position

title: NL - Handling of teams with same name > Detroit Stars (1937)
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN they select "Negro American League" on the "Leagues" filter
AND they select "Detroit Stars (1937)" on the "Teams" filter
AND click the "G" header to change the sort in the table
custom_expected: THEN a list of players should be displayed with "Eli Underwood" in first position

title: NL - Handling of teams with same name > St. Louis Stars (1936 - 1937)
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN they select "Negro American League" on the "Leagues" filter
AND they select "St. Louis Stars (1936 - 1937)" on the "Teams" filter
AND click the "G" header to change the sort in the table
custom_expected: THEN a list of players should be displayed with "Les Parson" in first position

title: NL - Handling of teams with same name > St. Louis Stars (1920 - 1931)
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Stats page
custom_steps:
WHEN they select "Negro National League (I)" on the "Leagues" filter
AND they select "St. Louis Stars (1920 - 1931)" on the "Teams" filter
AND click the "G" header to change the sort in the table
custom_expected: THEN a list of players should be displayed with "Branch Russell" in first position

title: MIG interactive elements are responsive
custom_preconds: Web app is in logged-out state

title: MIG Game Result Accuracy
custom_steps: 1. Verify that the MIG component correctly displays the outcome of the game, indicating which team won and the final score.

title: MIG Player Performance Highlights
custom_steps: 1. Check that the MIG component accurately highlights top performers from both teams, including their key statistics such as hits, home runs, RBIs, and runs scored. Ensure that the component can handle scenarios where there are no notable performances from one of the teams.

title: MIG Pitching Records
custom_steps: 1. Confirm the MIG component displays the correct winning and losing pitchers, along with their win-loss records and ERA.

title: MIG Game Story Integration
custom_steps: 1. Ensure that the MIG component appropriately incorporates related news or transactions, such as player trades or signings.

title: MIG Date Accuracy
custom_steps: 1. Check that the MIG component displays the correct game date.

title: MIG Navigation Functionality
custom_steps: 1. Test that navigation options (e.g., 'Wrap,' 'Box,' 'Video,' 'Story') are functional and lead to the correct content or related information.

title: MIG Logo Display
custom_steps: 1. Verify that the MIG component displays the correct logos for both teams involved in the game.

title: Free User no Favorite Team
custom_preconds:
1. User is logged into the application.
2. User is identified as a 'Free' tier user.
3. User has not previously selected a favorite team.
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to the main dashboard/home screen.
2. Locate the area designated for displaying or selecting a favorite team.
custom_expected:
The favorite team area should clearly indicate that no team is selected.
There should be a visible call-to-action or prompt for the user to select a favorite team.

title: Audio Only User
custom_preconds:
1. User is logged into the application.
2. User is identified as an 'Audio Only' subscriber or has this preference set.
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to content sections (e.g., live games, archives).
2. Attempt to access video streams.
3. Attempt to access audio streams.
custom_expected:
User should be blocked or prompted to upgrade when attempting to access video streams.
User should be able to successfully access audio streams.
UI might be tailored for audio-focused experience.

title: Paid User
custom_preconds:
1. User is logged into the application.
2. User is identified as a 'Paid' subscriber (e.g., monthly/yearly).
3. User may or may not have selected a favorite team.
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to the main dashboard/home screen.
2. Observe features related to subscription status (e.g., no ads, access indicators).
3. Locate the favorite team display area (if applicable).
custom_expected:
Features exclusive to paid users should be active/visible.
Favorite team display should function correctly based on whether a team is selected.
User should not see prompts related to upgrading.

title: Game User with Favorite Team
custom_preconds:
1. User is logged into the application.
2. User is identified as a 'Game' access user (e.g., single game purchase).
3. User has previously selected a favorite team.
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to the main dashboard or game-related section.
2. Locate the area designated for displaying the favorite team.
custom_expected:
The user's selected favorite team should be clearly displayed, potentially influencing game-related content shown.
Options to view team details or change the favorite team should be available.

title: Free User with Favorite Team
custom_preconds:
1. User is logged into the application.
2. User is identified as a 'Free' tier user.
3. User has previously selected a favorite team.
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to the main dashboard/home screen.
2. Locate the area designated for displaying the favorite team.
custom_expected:
The user's selected favorite team should be clearly displayed.
There might be options to view team details or change the favorite team.

title: Navigate to Homescreen Page View - Free User - No Favorite Team
custom_preconds: **Given** I am a free user with no favorite team selected
custom_steps:
**When** I navigate to the Home Run Derby application

**When** I access the Home Screen page
custom_expected:
**Then** I should see the default Home Screen view

**And** I should see general Home Run Derby information

**And** I should not see any favorite team specific content

title: Check that Tracker link takes you to Derby Tracker
custom_preconds:
1. User is on the home screen.
2. A link/button labeled "Tracker" or similar, related to the Home Run Derby, is visible (e.g., within the FTS card).
custom_steps:
1. Locate the "Tracker" link/button.
2. Tap/click the "Tracker" link/button.
custom_expected: The application navigates the user to the dedicated "Derby Tracker" screen/section.

title: Tab bar shows HRD trophy icon next to home and it will take you to Derby Tracker
custom_preconds:
1. User is logged into the application.
2. The Home Run Derby event is active or upcoming (logic might vary).
custom_steps:
1. Observe the main tab bar at the bottom of the screen.
2. Look for an icon representing the Home Run Derby (e.g., a trophy) near the "Home" tab.
3. Tap the HRD icon.
custom_expected: The HRD trophy icon is displayed in the tab bar as specified. Tapping the icon navigates the user directly to the Derby Tracker screen.

title: Confirm HRD shows in calendar bar
custom_preconds:
1. User is on the home screen.
2. The Home Run Derby event is scheduled for today or a future date visible in the calendar bar.
custom_steps:
1. Observe the calendar bar/strip at the top/relevant section of the home screen.
2. Look for an entry representing the Home Run Derby.
custom_expected: The Home Run Derby event is visible in the calendar bar with appropriate labeling (e.g., icon, text).

title: Check that Tickets link takes you to tickets page
custom_preconds:
1. User is on the home screen.
2. A link/button labeled "Tickets" or similar, related to the Home Run Derby, is visible.
custom_steps:
1. Locate the "Tickets" link/button.
2. Tap/click the "Tickets" link/button.
custom_expected: The application navigates the user to the appropriate ticketing page (either in-app or via an external browser) for the Home Run Derby event.

title: Check that those FTS and Calendar links are accurately displayed in ES
custom_preconds:
1. User has set the application language to Spanish (Español).
2. User is on the home screen.
3. The Home Run Derby event is visible in the calendar bar and/or FTS.
custom_steps:
1. Verify the application language is Spanish.
2. Observe the calendar bar entry for HRD.
3. Observe the FTS card for HRD.
4. Check the text of any links (Tracker, Tickets, Story) associated with HRD.
custom_expected: All text related to the HRD event in the calendar bar, FTS, and associated links (Tracker, Tickets, Story) is displayed correctly in Spanish. Links still function as expected.

title: Confirm image, event name, date, time and broadcast information included in FTS on home
custom_preconds:
1. User is on the home screen.
2. The Home Run Derby event is featured prominently (e.g., in a Featured Team Section - FTS or similar card).
custom_steps:
1. Locate the featured section/card for the Home Run Derby on the home screen.
2. Examine the information presented within this section.
custom_expected: The section displays: a relevant image, the event name ("Home Run Derby"), the correct date, the correct start time, and information about where to watch (broadcast details).

title: Rotate your phone
custom_preconds:
1. User is on the home screen.
2. Device orientation lock is disabled.
custom_steps:
1. Observe the layout in portrait orientation.
2. Rotate the device to landscape orientation.
3. Observe the layout in landscape orientation.
4. Rotate back to portrait.
custom_expected: The home screen layout adapts correctly to both portrait and landscape orientations without crashing, overlapping elements, or losing information. All elements (calendar, FTS, links) remain visible and functional.

title: Check that those FTS and Calednar links are accurately displayed in JP
custom_preconds:
1. User has set the application language to Japanese.
2. User is on the home screen.
3. The Home Run Derby event is visible in the calendar bar and/or FTS.
custom_steps:
1. Verify the application language is Japanese.
2. Observe the calendar bar entry for HRD.
3. Observe the FTS card for HRD.
4. Check the text of any links (Tracker, Tickets, Story) associated with HRD.
custom_expected: All text related to the HRD event in the calendar bar, FTS, and associated links (Tracker, Tickets, Story) is displayed correctly in Japanese. Links still function as expected.

title: Large and standard font
custom_preconds: 1. User is on the home screen.
custom_steps:
1. Set the device's font size to a standard/default setting.
2. Observe the text elements on the home screen (calendar, FTS details, link text).
3. Go to device settings and increase the font size significantly (e.g., using Dynamic Type settings).
4. Return to the application's home screen.
5. Observe the text elements again.
custom_expected: All text elements on the home screen scale appropriately with the device's font size settings. Text does not get truncated, overlap, or become unreadable at larger sizes. Layout adjusts gracefully to accommodate larger text.

title: Check that Story link takes you to story
custom_preconds:
1. User is on the home screen.
2. A link/button labeled "Story", "News", or similar, related to the Home Run Derby, is visible.
custom_steps:
1. Locate the "Story" link/button.
2. Tap/click the "Story" link/button.
custom_expected: The application navigates the user to a relevant news article or story page about the Home Run Derby.

title: A11y
custom_preconds:
1. User is on the home screen.
2. Accessibility features (e.g., VoiceOver, TalkBack) are enabled on the device.
custom_steps:
1. Navigate through the home screen elements using the accessibility features.
2. Focus on the calendar bar HRD entry, FTS HRD card, and associated links (Tracker, Tickets, Story), and the tab bar HRD icon (if present).
custom_expected: All relevant elements (images, text, buttons, links, icons) have appropriate accessibility labels, hints, and traits. Navigation order is logical. Elements are focusable and actionable using accessibility controls. Dynamic content updates are announced.

title: Confirm Calendar Bar Shows HRD
custom_expected: HRD Event should be pink in color to match T-Mobile Sponsor

title: Large and standard font
custom_preconds: 1. User is on a relevant Team Page.
custom_steps:
1. Set the device's font size to a standard/default setting.
2. Observe the text elements on the Team Page.
3. Go to device settings and increase the font size significantly (e.g., using Dynamic Type settings).
4. Return to the application's Team Page.
5. Observe the text elements again.
custom_expected: All text elements on the Team Page scale appropriately with the device's font size settings. Text does not get truncated, overlap, or become unreadable at larger sizes. Layout adjusts gracefully to accommodate larger text.

title: Tab bar shows HRD trophy icon next to home and it will take you to Derby Tracker.
custom_preconds:
1. User is logged into the application (on any screen, including Team Page).
2. The Home Run Derby event is active or upcoming (logic might vary).
custom_steps:
1. Observe the main tab bar at the bottom of the screen.
2. Look for an icon representing the Home Run Derby (e.g., a trophy) near the "Home" tab.
3. Tap the HRD icon.
custom_expected: The HRD trophy icon is displayed in the tab bar as specified. Tapping the icon navigates the user directly to the Derby Tracker screen. (This is global behavior, verified from Team Page).

title: Rotate your phone
custom_preconds:
1. User is on a relevant Team Page.
2. Device orientation lock is disabled.
custom_steps:
1. Observe the layout in portrait orientation.
2. Rotate the device to landscape orientation.
3. Observe the layout in landscape orientation.
4. Rotate back to portrait.
custom_expected: The Team Page layout adapts correctly to both portrait and landscape orientations without crashing, overlapping elements, or losing information. All elements remain visible and functional.

title: A11y
custom_preconds:
1. User is on a relevant Team Page.
2. Accessibility features (e.g., VoiceOver, TalkBack) are enabled on the device.
custom_steps:
1. Navigate through the Team Page elements using the accessibility features.
2. Focus on any HRD related elements (calendar entries, links, info sections) and general page elements.
custom_expected: All relevant elements on the Team Page have appropriate accessibility labels, hints, and traits. Navigation order is logical. Elements are focusable and actionable using accessibility controls.

title: Confirm HRD shows in calendar bar.
custom_preconds:
1. User is on a relevant Team Page.
2. The Home Run Derby event is scheduled for a date visible in the page's date navigation element (if applicable).
custom_steps:
1. Observe any date navigation elements (e.g., calendar strip, schedule view) present on the Team Page.
2. Look for an entry representing the Home Run Derby on the relevant date.
custom_expected: If the Team Page displays date-based events, the Home Run Derby event is visible in the navigation element with appropriate labeling.

title: Confirm image, event name, date, time and broadcast information included in HRD section on Team Page

title: Confirm click through takes you to HRD Tracker
custom_preconds:
1. User is logged in (any type).
2. The Home Run Derby event is active or upcoming.
